markdownRemark.html:
In a previous post I dived into the Danish Ministry of Educations school initiative to lift the students with the poorest academic performances. The point made in the post were that the evaluation of the schools relied on so little data, that the payouts would be a lottery. A couple of months ago the result and payout for each school was announced for the first year of the initiative. The ministry claims that 400 students improved their performance as a result of the initiative 1.

The 62 schools has on average decreased the proportion of students on that level with almost 14 percentage points compared to their starting points. The amounts to the schools improving more than 400 students.

The Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR) had gained access to documents detailing the performance for this year and the three previous years, where amongst other things found schools that received the payout but had decreased the general performance 2. I asked them to share their data to have a closer look. It turned out that not only had the ministry not accounted for regression towards the mean, they also only included schools who actually improved not all schools in the initiative and they used a regular mean where a weighted mean should have been applied. With these errors the true number of students improved as a result of the initiative is closer to 200 than 400.

I shared this finding with DR and part of it found its way into the

1 The Ministry of Education: 62 skoler får penge fra skolepuljen 2 DR: Elever får dårligere karakterer, men skolerne bliver belønnet med 8 millioner kroner

frontmatter.title: Winning the School Lottery
frontmatter.subtitle: The Danish Ministry of Education has now paid out bonuses to the schools participating in the school initiative. They claim that 400 students were improved as a result. This number does however not hold up.
The Danish Ministry of Education has issued an 500M DKK initiative to improve danish students. But the payouts are largely a lottery.
frontmatter.title: Lottery tickets to Danish Schools
